arts.ttl: Bloomfield declares Luton's fighting spirit shone through with Hull victory
arts.sum: Town give their survival chances a huge boost

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles admits Hull City lost their 'identity' after freak Luton Town goal
arts.sum: From the moment Lewie Coyle's clearance hit Alfie Jones and cannoned back into the Tigers' net 26 seconds into the second half, it felt like Selles' side would find it difficult to find a way through. "In that period, after we conceded the goal, it took us almost 30 minutes to get back to the game in the proper way in the things that we did.

arts.ttl: Comical own goal sees Luton claw three vitals points back on Tigers
Chaotic OG hands Luton hope in survival battle
arts.sum: Alfie Jones scored a freak own goal to gift Luton a 1-0 victory in their relegation six-pointer at Hull.

arts.ttl: Alfie Jones’ own goal gifts Luton victory in relegation six-pointer at Hull
arts.sum: Hull captain Lewie Coyle smashed a clearance into his team-mate Jones and it backfired by ending up in their own net early in the second half.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings as Puerta, Gelhardt, Palmer and Joseph struggle in Luton Town loss
arts.sum: A tight and cagey first half saw City fail to hit the target while at the other end, Luton's best effort came from Elijah Adebayo who hit the post with a fierce drive across goal. Lewie Coyle: His 150th City start, and he was one of City's better-attacking threats in a quiet first period.

arts.ttl: Hull City will find it 'hard to deal with' relegation rivals Luton Town, claims Tigers old boy
arts.sum: Reece Burke believes if Luton Town reach the levels they have in recent weeks, Hull City will find it difficult to cope with the second-bottom Hatters. But their upturn in form in recent weeks has given Burke renewed optimism the Bedfordshire club can survive in the final eight games, starting with the 12:30pm kick-off on his old stomping ground.

arts.ttl: Luton chief wants Town to gain some ground on their relegation rivals
arts.sum: Hatters take on Hull in the Championship’s early kick-off

arts.ttl: Hull City given perfect opportunity to make much-needed Championship statement
arts.sum: Worst case scenario for Luton would be sitting seven points adrift of safety with only seven games left to play, so Matt Bloomfield will know victory is so important . While it's not quite last chance saloon for the Hatters, defeat would be inherently damaging with the overall damage not fully known until 5pm on Saturday afternoon after Stoke City and Cardiff City have played their respective games.

arts.ttl: Town boss feels language barrier makes Makosso's impact at Luton even more impressive
arts.sum: January acquisition can barely speak any English
